turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm looking at my latest bill and there's a charge here I don't understand. Can you help?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I can certainly help you with that. To access your billing information, could you please provide your account number or the email address associated with your account?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, my email is [user_email@example.com]. The charge in question is from [Date] for [Amount] with the description 'Service Fee - Level 2'. I don't know what 'Level 2' service is, I thought I only had the basic plan.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you for providing the details. I see the charge you're referring to. 'Service Fee - Level 2' typically relates to an add-on feature or a higher tier of service that was active during that billing cycle.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: But I never signed up for any add-ons, and I've been on the basic plan for over a year! Why would I suddenly be charged for a 'Level 2' service I didn't request and wasn't using? This doesn't make sense at all.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your confusion. Let me double-check the account history for any changes or activations around that date. Sometimes promotional periods end, or there might have been a system update that affected billing descriptions.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, so what did you find? Was there a mistake or did you automatically upgrade me without telling me? Because that feels really unfair. I'm getting pretty frustrated about this.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: My system records indicate the charge is valid based on the service code present, but I cannot definitively determine *why* it was applied if no manual change was made or promo ended. This requires a deeper investigation into your specific account history and the service provisioning logs. I will create a support ticket for you right now and escalate it to our billing specialists. They will review it and contact you within 24-48 business hours with a resolution or request for more information.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Alright, a ticket it is. I hope they can actually explain this and fix it. It's annoying that you can't figure it out, but I appreciate you escalating it. Please make sure they understand I didn't authorize this.
